text: Draft at brew dock. Nose is orange, mandarin, apricot, Peach. Palate is still very fruity, even though this is 3 weeks past the sell by date (still sell it for 10  a pint here).. Some grains have taken over, but still very pleasant and smooth. Great, even at the end of its run. This keg must have been well kept.
Tap @ The Brew Dock. Pours murky pale amber with a good head. Aroma is joy juicy fruity citric. Flavor is juicy hoppy sweet fruity, very fullbodied mouthfeel. Extremely session able.
Di un bellissimo color arancio con schiuma pressochè inesistente. Un succo di frutta tropicale. Purtroppo non al top della freschezza ma senzaltro grande.

Can shared at muckfest. Hazed gold with a white head of foam. Aroma is paper and mango. Dried paper is the dominant characteristic. A little fruity. Medium body and medium carbonation. 3 months old and way past its prime. Unless those brits love the taste of paper, that is.
Can thanks to Cloin. Pours a cloudy gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is earth, dank, grapefruit, resin. Medium body, juicy, grapefruit, dank, lingering bitterness, very good.
Can at Muckfest 2017. Strong dank nose. Cloudy orange to gold. Taste is decent. A tired flavor but solid.

Can courtesy of Sander (thanks man!); shared at As Is. [Older can - probably requires a revisit] Despite the age, the beer still has a pretty great palate with notes of sweet fruit, some raisin bread and sweep malt creeping in.

Can from Werckmeister, many thanks, Stefan.  Hazy orange golden color with medium white head. Strong aroma of citrus hops, oranges, grapefruits, zest, pines. Taste, solid malty base followed by nice citrus hops, zest, pines. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.

Fresh Can. MBBC Trade. Pours hazy orange With a White head. Juicy and tropical. Reminds me of how good Kernel are. Brilliant shiny fresh hops. Minimal yeast and oats. Super bitterness. Really soft and tasty! Yes! Best Cloudwater to date!

Can from Good Spirits Co. Wine & Beer. Muddy orange yellow, good head. Mixed fruit juice & alcohol aroma & flavour. Juicy texture with alcohol aftertaste. Not as good as their newer efforts, might be because it was just past the BB date.
Pours dark golden with a thin white head. Aroma is as expected tropical fruits, mainly mango. Very good drinkability with loads of juice. Full mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

From a taster, courtesy of SinH4, many thanks! Pours hazy amber orange. Aroma is fruit salat, tropical fruit, mango, melon, apricot, passion fruit. Body is strong and heavy, super sweet and fruity, but very smooth and highly drinkable. Onion palate, still fruity and sweet, lingering. Extremely drinkable and punchy. Excellent!

Can huge thanks to Leighton cracked @ As Is NYC. Pours a cloudy deep orange, white head. aroma is grapefruit, candied sugar, light caramel, booze. Flavor is similar, lightly boozed juice, candied citrus.

Cloudy golden with medium white head. Aroma is peach grass toasty malt pepper some more exotic fruit. Taste is sharp hoppy lychee with lots of fruity sweetness and lots of bitter hops later. Very balanced. Slight mealyness on the tongue. A bit dry and sharp but still very balanced and refreshing.

Can, many thanks Werckmeister! Hazy pale orange color with small white head. Aroma is mango, passion fruit, a touch garlic, some leek, grassy, some dextro. Taste is the same, with lots of tropical fruits and grassyness, a touch of wheat, super refreshing with a tiny bit of sweath in the finish. Refreshing medium carbonation that gives a touch of a mineralic bite. Excellent!

Can, danke fürs teilen Wer kmeister&Stefan. Fresh oniony (Bärlauch) and lychee hop notes. Milky/murky yellow, white head. Medium full dry, hay, sugary base. Grassy and tropical, quite intense, surprisingly fresh.

(can, many thanks to sinh4!) murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of mango, onions and sugar icing, with a light touch of green bell pepper, some yeast and ginger powder. flavour is mostly tropical fruit, lots of mango, kiwi and papaya, rather on the sweet side, with some notes of bran flakes and a herbal-hoppy medium-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with lively carbonation. very nice!

16 oz. can. Very hazy orange. Smells super tropical. Mango, oats, kinda sweet smelling. Tastes much the same as the nose. Sweet, tropical fruits, slight garlic bite. Some oats, but not as much as it smells. Pretty sweet. Almost no bitterness. Medium heavy. I know the can is a few days past its "Best by" date, but Im still not sure this is as good as the rates suggest.

Can 0.44l@ unfortunately is BBE may 2017. So I catch the last Train. Pours yellowish golden, cloudy with foamy white lasting head. Aroma: biscuit like malt aroma and huge hop profile with notes of citeuses, grapefruit, tangerine, nectarine, peaches, tropical fruits as pineapple, mango, dank....flavour is also intense, but its not equal to aroma; crisp, biscuit like malt backbone, supported with hop flavours which takes on fruits mentioned by aroma, esters with notes of peaches? - Hop bitterness is medium to high, higher as by v11 as I remember, fruity, citrusy bitterness gentle lingers in aftertaste.
Body is medium, texture smooth, juicy, carbonation medium - low.

can, very hazy, orange-yellow, small white head.
odour: very hoppy, fruity, passion fruit, manderine, grapefruit, nectarine.
additionaly in taste: peach, nectarine
light to medium bitter finish, alcoholic finish, full body.

440 ml can from Werckmeister, many thanks. Pours a very hazy orange-yellow with a white head. Very fruity aroma with loads of fruits - grapefruit, mango, peach, lemon - along with some fresh green nearly grassy/herbal notes. Medium to full pillowy body with a low carbonation a light to medium sweetness and a light to medium bitterness. The flavor is again very fruity and very juicy (mango, peach, oranges, grapefruits) along with a light, herbal, peppery dankness and a light alcoholic feeling in the finish.
Can - pours hazy yellow/orange. Nose is lots of citrus fruit. Tast is oranges, grapefruit, lemons, tangerines. Slight bitterness. Well balanced.

Can, man. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Grapefruit hop bouquet. Citrus hop notes dominate. Thinking there might be some apricot undercurrents. Muted caramel malt backbeats. Good body with an average mouthfeel.
Can thanks to Alex. Cloudy golden beer with a big off white head. Heavy tropical aroma, peach, herbal notes. Hoppy fruity flavor, tropical, citrus, some malts bringing balance. Solid as hell.

THNX to Stefan !!! Poursbunclear yellow. Small white head. Smell is intense fruity, mild tropical, bready malts. Taste is full, sharp, intense hoppyness. Citra, as well as tropical fruits. Bready malty back. Very intense, rather crisp. Clean , hoppy finish. Very nice.

Can. Pours a deep hazy orange with a slowly fading fluffy foamy white head. Aroma is exotic fruits, mango, pineapple, passionfruit, papaya, orange, citrus, melon, grapefruit. Taste is of more exotic fruits, citrus, orange, grapefruit, grassy. Full thick mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Can @ home. Murky deep golden pour with a generous head. Tons of mangoes, passion fruit and stone fruit! Sticky sweet, some light esters and super fruity. Wow!
A: Cloudy orange with a nice white head N: Mango, grapefruit, hay, pine T: Mango again, lots of fresh cut hay, papaya, hint of orange O: Very nice IPA with a lovely fruityness. Nice!

Can from mchughs. Pours murky marmalade orange. Citrus, lemon, orange juice. Flavour is a caramel sweet with citrus grapefruit bitter finish. Pure fruit juice. Substantial body. Slight vegetal notes from the hops.
Pours hazy orange peach with a white head. Aroma is orange and peach. Taste is peach sweet, orange sweet, grapefruit bitter, tropical fruits. Solid fruit juice.
Can @Luppolo Station (Rome), thanks Gabo. Cloudy pulp yellow fruit pour, white foam. Nose: fruity esters, yeast, citra blast. Mouth is velvety, fruity, elegant, end has a garlic pinch. Joyful.

Keg at BrewDog, Clapham, London in May 2017 - Murky orangey gold in colour. Medium foamy white head. Citrus and tropical fruity aroma. Very fruity taste, very citrus fruity, orange, grapefruit, tropical fruit, peach, mango. Piney resinous hops. Spicy. Malty backbone. Sweet-bitter juicy citrus and tropical fruity and hoppy throughout. Very drinkable. Terrific fruity hoppy DIPA. Enjoyed this. (2017-05)

Super turbid. Smells like pineapple. Wow, this is good. Fruity. Total juice bomb, with some nice piney bitterness at the end. Thx Clownoisseur, i feel lucky that you sent this to me! This tastes extremely similar to the Narrow Gauge Double Dry Hopped Fallen Flag I just had a few days ago....but this is a bit bigger and juicier.
Can from a friend. Very hoppy smell, fresh with citrus and tropical fruits. Similar taste, juicy. Low bitterness. Almost too fresh with some hop bag aromas, but still very nice! Awsome beer!
Quite simply the perfect beer (if you like IPA with a soft mouthfeel). So easy drinking for a DIPA. Great aroma and aftertaste.

Can @Mad for Beer (Rome). Color succo di frutta alla pera, torbida, opalescente,schiuma bianca media. Al naso sentori di mango, pesca e passionfruit. In bocca gran base di malto con finale amaro lunghissimo, rotonda, fruttata e vellutata. Corpo pieno, carbonazione media. Grande birra.

Can from the brother. Cheers JamesTulloch! Pours a hazed orange with a lively head that fades leaving nice lacing. Aromas of pineapple, lychee, orange, mango, pink grapefruit, lime zest and mixed herbs. Flavour is again mango, grapefruit, oranges, boiled sweets (lemon). Amazing citrus pith linger. Enjoyed in the sun. Probably one of the best DIPA I have had. Incredible from Cloudwater.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2017 On keg at Thomas Tallis Canterbury. Cloudy as hell like unfiltered pineapple juice as an appearance. Lasting white head. I smelt the tropical fruit as it was put in front of me. Some dank hop. Some pineapple some mango. Medium bitterness on the finish. it?s a bit fizzy over carbonated. it?s very tropical fruit juicy. hides abv well. it is too fizzy. harsh carbonic acid on the finish. would be better on cask. no problem with the temp. after all the hype it is somewhat of a disappointment no doubt. Some kernel pale ales are better than this in my opinion. make me go berserk more.  Lasting impressions. it looks like pineapple juice. it has a great tropical fruit aroma but with dank hops that don?t turn me on. spiciness on aroma. it?s good, excellent in fact like drinking pineapple juice that?s too fizzy. but it is too fizzy. bitterness is light. doesn?t have a huge finish. pineapple mango some orange. good but not outstanding. mind you I did have the second half pint because I liked it. might have a third depends how I feel. really easy drinking. Dank tea leaf on third half pint

440ml can from Ales by Mail (thanks for sending me a new box after the first one was broken in transit). Canned 24/03/17. BBE MAY17. Pours cloudy dark orange with a smooth foamy head. Aroma of juicy fruits, citrus, malts, caramel, tropical notes and grapefruit. Taste is smooth, sweetish and malty with some super soft juicy fruitiness, citrus, hints of pine, grass and grapefruit. Finish is soft, juicy, sweetish and slightly boozy with some warming alcohol, maltiness and loads of tropical fruits. Sweet and heavy, unfortunately a bit past its prime already.

Can thanks to Werkmeister . Murky yellow body with white head. Aroma is fruity and fruity with tropical fruits some pines and caramel malts. Taste is also fruity and citrus with caramel and hints of grains in the background. Aftertaste is fruity sweet balanced by some nice mild bitterness. Perfect

30th March 2017Can. Citra BBC and Mosaic hops. Murky gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light, mildly dry, good fine carbonation. Light sweet malts, touch of cream. Some dextrose sweetness. Mild hop skunk. Good pine. Plenty of hop spice. Light seltzer. Little orange in to good mango led tropical fruits. More hop spice, pretty strong now. Light and slightly bitter finish. Very nice indeed. Assessed over 3 cans and over 3 and a bit weeks. The 2nd can was the best after about 10 days, the 3rd had faded a little.

Ben, thanks for the can! Please send some more, lol.
Awesome looking, hazy, great head, lacing, perfectly carbed. The arome could bit a bit more intense but this is not "fresh as fuck" anymore so it is acceptable and still nice. The taste is extremely tropical, dry mango, some pineapple. Not very citrusy but some grapefruit on the finish is noticeable. Light, fruity bitterness. Pretty sticky. More like a juice than a beer. Possibly the best New England DIPA in Europe. Yup, I said that.

V series going out on a high note. 
Looks like pure juice. 
Tropical fruit aroma literally burst out of the can when opened. 
Smoothie-like mouthfeel leading to mango and pineapple with a tad citrus zing. 
Great stuff.

Can in trade from Geemsy, thanks a bunch Gary! Pours a deep orange with peach hurs. Very hazy and slightly murky. Think off-white cap breaks into fine lace. Aromas of grapefruit zest, orange peel, peaches, mangos, light earthy grass and a light bread crumb. Taste is nicely balanced between bold dry-hop flavor. Green grass, cannabis and an earthy note provide a light bitterness and a slight astringency mid-palate. Sweetens as it warms. Nice bouquet of flowers compliment more peach, mango, papaya as suggested in nose. Finishes slightly dry with a mild, bitter note. Cereal malts interplay with a unique yeast note...more peach...some green apple and light spice follow. A medium to high medium mouthfeel...sticky and resinous. Finish lingers on the palate. Really tasty beer!
One of the best from Cloudwater, similar to DIPA birthday. Great burst of flavour and mega heavy with hops. Floral, citrus and lots of good things!

Can received in trade. Very hazy tiny burnt orange pour with a creamy offwhite head. Sticky heavy hoppy nose with overripe tangerine, grapefruit, mango, moist grass, thistles & chives. Oatmeal cookies & white bread. Sweet, slightly bitter, fruity & grassy taste. Soft, round, tiny syrupy & tiny astringent mouthfeel. Heavy sticky ripe fruits & grass. Very good beer but gets a bit too heavy & sticky for me. Perhaps it was brighter fresh (canned march 28). I look forward to trying more CW hops in Cph next week!Opened up very nicely after about 30 minutes in the glass. Heavier on the fruit with less sticky overripe character.

Can from Otters Tears, Burslem. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a thin white head. Aroma of pineapple, mango, lychee, orange, some grapefruit, a little peach, dank, slight biscuity malts, a hint of oats and subtle floral hops. Taste of pineapple, mango, lychee, peach, some orange, slight lemon, a little grapefruit, dank, a hint of pine, a touch of biscuity malts and subtle floral hops. Medium bodied and an oily texture. A long, tropical fruit bitterness in the finish. The fruitiest and actually the most bitter out of all the DIPAs. Great body like the v11 and wonderful overall.

Can with huge props to Ben! Pours cloudy OJ with a medium kinda fizzy white head that dissipates pretty quickly nevertheless leaving decent residual and lacing. Aroma is super dank and juicy, tropical fruit, pot, hints of armpit, papaya. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, dank juicy bomb. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Really really good.

Can 44cl. Hazy orange beer with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, hops, tropical fruits, mango. Light to medium body, soft carbonation. Taste is citrus, fruits, light bitter at the start and more after a few sip. Does not feel 9adv. Great doubleIPA, light bitter ending. 05/17

440ml Can from Good Spirits Wine & Beer, Glasgow (£5.90):
Excellent stuff again from Cloudwater, they are definitely a brewery that know how to make excellent DIPAs & this one is no exception. The beer started a little slower than Id have liked & the nose was far from as strong as previous offering but it wasnt quite week either; it did eventually open up with some nice citrus notes & the odd hop but it could definitely have been stronger. Thankfully things improved substantially come the nose & plenty of hop bitterness featured alongside strong malts & various tropical fruits to give the beer an excellent taste. Its probably not as good as some previous offering from the brewery, especially there DIPA v10 & v11 in this series but it was still a great beer & one Id have again; if only the nose was a little better then it might have been something truly special.

Can. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity peachy grapefruit hoppy bitter aroma. Fruity malty grapefruit hoppy bitter peachy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.

On tap at Beer Boutique. Almost opaque golden colour, white head. Aroma of lots of hoppy citrus and tropical fruits, peach, melon, mango, light malty, lemon peel. Flavour is light to medium sweet, light malty, mainly fruity, citrus and grapefruit first, later on more melon, apricot, peach, not fruits I particularly like. Soft bitter finish. Medium bodied at best, drinks way too easy for 9%. Expected more tbh.

500ml can. Hazy pale yellow. Nose sharp floral light grassy notes. Oily. Taste very fruity. Were fruity notes. Finish fruity and floral. Awesome fruity notes. Taste more complex than nose. Very. Ice finish. Wow world class. Awesome complexity.

Quite simply magnificent. One of the best DIPAs around. Certainly one of the best New England IPAs. Cloudy and tasty 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Canned. Light amber coloured. Hazy. Dense off white head. Aroma. Dense herbs and flowers, Tropical fruits, sweetness, citrus. Flavour. Tropical fruits, herbs, flowers, citrus, some caramel, Meidum to full bodied. Ends dense flowery bitter. NIce.

From a can, a delicious pineapple , passion fruit and melon aroma, the oats give a thick and almost creamy mouthfeel. A light tropical fruit flavour, that is almost completely devoid of any trace of alcohol , which is pretty amazing given its abv .

Can as a birthday present from Richthevillan. Big thanks for this Rich. Hazy golden beer with medium head. Aroma of mango, tropical fruit, resin and stewed fruit. Taste is stewed fruits, pine resin, grapefruit, mango, some sherbet and tropical fruit. Chewy body. Excellent world class DIPA.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Can shared with sarky northner cheers Martin. Great hazy golden colour with foamy white head. Aroma is great juicy fruits mango pineapple orange taste is same so juicy with a great dry hoppy bitter finish. Very good this.

Pyszne piwo. Czuć, że gdyby było świeższe było by lepsze, ale nadal nie jest źle. Piękny, wzorcowy wygląd w szkle. Lekko mętne, ale nie jest to mimo wszystko typowy neipa. W smaku zero alkoholu, bardzo "syte" i pełne. Goryczka intensywna, ale krótka i nie zalegająca.

Świetne piwo.
Can. An unclear yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, hops, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, straw, and flowers, leading to a bitter finish.

Shared by Justin. Thank you sir! 49/50 on the top rated beers list. Caution light yellow body, hazy, white soapy head. Aromas of melon, pineapple, guava. Hop forward and delicious. Super juicy. Absolutely wonderful.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - (thanks to Anders) golden yellow pour with white head. Aroma and taste is resonating tropical and citrus fruity, lots of grapefruit, tangerine, mango, juicy fruity and punch hoppy, smooth mouthfeel, drinks well below the abv, seriously quaffable, could murder loads of this.

Sample from 50 cl can. Milky golden colour with a fluffy white head. Fruity aroma with grasses, toasted notes, exotic impressions, floral notes. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body. Finishes lasting dry and bitter with rich floral hops. Excellent.

Can at yespr.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles with notes of citrus.
Fruity flavor of hops, exotic fruits and citrus with notes of pine needles.
Hoppy finish.
50 cl. can. A hazy yellow coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit, citrus, grapefruit, peach and with a bitter finish.
50 cl can. Pours hazy to murky yellow, small white head. Aroma is solid hoppy. Light herbal.smooth fruity, peachy and mellow orange to nectarine mellow fruity. Smooth fruity finish.
Juicy with great aroma, citrusy, well-rounded, very drinkable quite possibly the best beer ever made...so far

Keg @ St.Petersgate Tap, Stockport [040317]
Creamy orange white, opaque, thin white head
Aroma of orange juice, tropical fruit juice, citrus zest, massive fruits, mango, grapefruit, big complex fruit juice
Taste - Big time tropical fruits, orange, grapefruit, mango, huge amount of citrus fruits, bitter zest, massive juicy fruits, great flavour
Palate - Soft carb, medium to full body, rich texture from the massive amount of oats in this, sticky juices, sweet pale malts, alcohol totally hidden, sweet beer, maybe a tad over sweet. Finish of citrus fruits, fairly bitter grapefruit and orange zest
Overall - Oats give a good texture, huge fruit juices. Its really nice. Superb DIPA.

Can from the Good Spirits Co Wine & Beer. Pours an opaque, milky gold, almost like orange juice, with a short lived head. Nose is intense, overwhelming tropical fruit: over-ripe tangerines and mandarins. Taste is equally intense, incredibly bitter-sweet, a mélange of fruit sweeties. Palate is surprisingly clean given the ABV and oat content, and not so much refreshing as bracing. Definitely in the top three of Cloudwater DIPAs

Keg at BEER:shop, Hitchin. Murky yellow with a bit of creamy head. Mind you the beer is so creamy its hard to tell where the beer ends and the head begins. Mango, mango, orange sherbet, coconut. passionfruit and more mango in the aroma. Tastes almost as good as it smells, but the alcohol is a bit heavy... just a bit mind you, its hard to be picky with this one. Sweetness on the finish, but no sickly notes and theres the perfect tinge of hoppy bitterness in the background for balance. This is amazing, and worth the hype. Not the best beer Ive had but certainly in the top 25-30.

10ml taster. Pours hazy yellow orange, nose is grapefruit, orange, taste is juicy citrus, sweet, little salty, pine, herbal. Murky peach... Soft sweet floral fruit nose... Juicy oily orange fruits nose.. Over fizzy... Sweet tropical fruit.. Juicy floral fruits.

Almost as good as Kernel IPAs

Aroma is sharp exotic tangerines, peaches, papaya, citrus and what not? Über fruity aroma with a lot of pine oil as well. Taste is thick and juicy. It almost has the mouthfeel of fruit juice, and also a little creamy or even oily if you will? Very juicy taste. It also has a larger "hit" of hops than the earlier versions. Piney, raw hop oily that creates a bite to it that many NE-style beers try to avoid. I think it sends this one right up to the skies as a rocket, and I wonder if it isnt the best one in the series?

Canned 28/03/17.Hazy orange color with white head looks exactly the way a NEIPA should look. Very forward juicy and hoppy aroma right out of the can. Full mouthfeel with nice texture for a DIPA.The taste is amazing, fruity , hoppy with minimal hop burn in the aftertaste, but the 9%abv does not show its presence anywhere.This is as drinkable as a 6% IPA. You could chug it easily.For the last 2 years ive had various Tree House (which are my favorite NEIPAs in general) , Trilium, Stigbergets , etc.. .This is as good as it gets until now in the European NEIPA style.I really hope Cloudwater will make a beer similar to this as a steady range beer someday.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 looks a delight in the glass and has an amazing fruity aroma. Hit with a massive burst of juice with a nice bitter ending. Amazing beer!
Pours really cloudy orange. Citrus and sherbet aroma. Mango and pine flavours, some peach and pineapple. Very well balanced, love it.

Can at home, 21st April 2017. Pours totally cloudy orange yellow, slight head. Aroma is sherbet, tropical fruit, citrus and pine. Taste is tropical fruit, citrus and pine, with more bitterness than the medicore version 12. There is a depth of flavour, slight numbness and huge linger from the bitter hops, complementing the sweet and amazing tropical fruit notes. No sign or heat from the 9.0 ABV. Great finale to the the series.

Pours a very hazy, thick looking yellow colour, frothy white head thats lasts. Unsure whether to settle and pour gently. Opted to chuck it all in the glass! Aroma - so resinous, like putting your head into a bag of freshly opened citra hops, all the mango, pineapple, peach and citrus you could get into a beer! Taste - so so juicy! Bitterness is there but only just. Peachy, candied lemon, pineapple sherbet. Almost like licking pine sap (not that I know what that tastes like)

Pours completely opaque golden, very cloudy, with decent white head which diminishes fairly quickly. Massive aromas of fresh pine, grass, pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of lemon zest. Softish carbonation but good mouth feel. Taste is west-coast hops, full of pine and hay, some lemon, nectarine, and grapefruit. Not a huge amount of malt but a hint of oats. Not as sweet as some of the previous DIPAs but I prefer this as it is easier to drink more of it. Nice bitter finish and doesnt exhibit any alcohol burn.

Nose packed with sweet tropical fruit- round and ripe mango, sweet orange tangerine, lots of peachy stone fruit. Slight caramel which unites the complex smell.
Super hazy, golden yellow like pulpy mango juice.
Phenomenally silky and full bodied. Like a milkshake.
Tastes glorious, mango pulp, sweet peach and stone fruit really balanced with low bitterness and a lovely alcoholic finish. 
So good
Sampel puszki. Aromat piękny, owocowy, egzotyczny, szczypta żywicy. Smak umiarkowanie gorzki, kremowy, mango, żywica, lekka słodycz. Świetne.

Can from BD Xoho, 19/04/17.
Rated by Brendan Doge.
Murky orange pour with a well presented light beige covering that stays for the show,
Nose is dank hop exhaust, pine resin, grapefruit slather, toasted brioche, hint of Um Bongo, Chimpy Chompy medley.
Taste comprises pine needle, dank envelope of lupin love, soft bread, mango, semi tarte pineapple, grapefruit zest.
Medium bodied, fine massaging carbonation, mildly aggresive danko hop burst at the curtain call.
Super solid DIPA ... absolutely top draw hop drool and masks the boosty ABV expertly !!!
Rechts oben meine Straße - big tim !!!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Poured from a 440ml can at home. Beer is a murky amber/orange with fluffy white head. The aroma is all tropical juicy fruits - grapefruit and orange. Mouthfeel is thick buy not cloying - easy drinking for its ABV. Taste is orange marmalade with grapefruit and mango with a nice bitterness on the back to balance this well. A great way to end the v series!

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 Keg at salty... Murky peach... Soft sweet floral fruit nose... Juicy oily orange fruits nose.. Over fizzy... Sweet tropical fruit.. Juicy floral fruits 

Keg at brewdog... Hazy amber.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet peach fruit.. Light passion fruit nose..  Not as fizzy... Juicy tropical fruit sweet orange fruits... Ok i was just a sample so was warmer flatter snd for way better 4.0

44cl can via Ales by Mail. It pours a murky apricot juice color with a minimal off white head. Aroma is super juicy fruity and super danky, as youve come to expect from Cloudwater DIPAs. Taste is a joyful reunion of all those danky sticky leafy hops and the juicy tropical fruits that made the Birthday DIPA the huge success it was. Just a tad boozier Id say. Full bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, this is great beer, but doesnt match the Birthday DIPA to me.

Sampled from both can and keg. Pours a murky dark golden with a billowy white head. Aroma is dank with all the usual tropical fruits, particularly mango. Superb drinkability with loads of juice and light bitterness. Slightly resinous. Little to no trace of the 9% abv. Relatively full mouthfeel and medium carb. Possibly the best of the series although I missed out on v11. Certainly my favorite artwork on the label.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared by MatC, thanks - Color: golden hazy beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: juicy lime and citrus domination. Fresh and fruity. Grassy hops. Intensive nose. Taste: full body with sweet malt backbone balanced with juicy hops, citrus and lime. Very intensive. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: lime and citrus, sweet wet bitterness. Great! One of my favorite!

Can from We Brought Beer, Balham. Opaque, cloudy, bright amber with orange tinges, and a medium to big bubbly white head. Nose is very very soft citrus fruit, grapefruit peel, orange juice, tropical notes of pineapple and mango, pine, with some astringency from the hop acids, Im getting slight bug spray/nylon new sneakers (my palate is often picks this up in highly hopped beers). Taste is soft citrus fruit, soft tropical fruits, papaya, pineapple, some herbal and minerally notes, some of that nylon sneakers thing, pine. Very citrus juicy beer. Doesnt taste high abv at all.

44 cl can @ Timo A. Canned on 24.03.2017. BBE 05/2017.
Pours murky orange color with a small head. Aroma is very tropical fruity with mango and passion fruit, some pineapple notes, pine, resin and some apricot notes. Flavor is also quite sweet and juicy with mango and passion fruit, resinous hoppy, a bit stuffy with all the fruit party, some malt notes, bitterness and subtle citrus. Alcohol is quite well hidden. A bit too stuffy for my taste, somewhat disappointing. Good juicy DIPA anyway.
5525

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 44 cl can @ Timo A. Canned 24.03.2017, BBE 05/2017. Aroma has pineapple juice, tropical fruits and fruit candy. Flavour has fruit candy, tropical fruit, grapefruit and pineapple juice. Also passionfruit juice. Somewhat aggressive hop profile. Nice, hides the ABV very well.

Bardzo intensywny aromat świeżych, dojrzałych, żółtych owoców. Barwa i konsystencja multiwitaminowego soku. Smak w sumie też :) Goryczka obecna, ale w fantastycznym wydaniu - króciutka i na maksa owocowa. Wyśmienite.

Can from Casc Aberdeen. Pours reminiscent of pineapple juice. Murky peachy gold with a thin yellow white head. Nose of earthy tea 
Leaf dryness, pine, grapefruit, peach and soft sharp raspberries. Flavours are sweet fruit with a light-spice dryness. Palate is a soft smooth juicy body with a light sharp sparkle. This is definitely the most complex of the series Ive experienced. It feels like each sip opens something new. But I prefer it stripped back and raw.

Bottle thanks to klimaet. Pours hazy unclear orange with a white head. Aroma is booming with mango, passion fruit, papaya, sweet orange, almost tropical yogurt, sweet citrus and pineapple. Taste of tropical sweet fruits. Lots of pineapple, mango, papaya, orange, peach and and passion fruit. Also you get a dank hop kick. NE all the way with a dank side to it.

Can thanks to klimaet. Aroma of smooth mango purée, citrus hops, green hops, passionfruit. Hazy yellow with white head. Taste is light+ sweet and light bitter. Medium body, oily smooth feel and tropical fruit finish.

Can thanks to Tad! Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of citrus, mango, pineapple, dank hops, guava. Taste is mango, pineapple, some passionfruit/guava sweetness, dank herbal hops, light citrus bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 Can at home from Eebria, Thanks to LKS. A translucent clouded golden orange coloured pour with a lasting fine white head. Aroma is huge spicy citrus, dank, juicy mango, little hot alcohol. Flavour is composed of semi sweet base malts, with oats and wheat, juicy pulped mango, spicy citrus, dank citrus. Palate is full and rounded, semi sweet, moderate carbonation. Hides and alcohol well and is very easy going. 

Second can side by side with the new NW DIPA citra. The v13 edges it for me. Flavour is softer, fruitier and more vibrant for me.

On tap at Torst. Pours a very cloudy amber. Spices and hops on the nose. Incredibly smooth. Very light bodied but medium to heavy bitterness. Very smooth finish. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap into a wineglass showing lightly filtered hazy orange with sparse white foam.

The nose shows moderate notes of kiwi and mango.

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of juicy apricot and mango with a light bitterness on the finish. Slightly astringent.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2017 So hoppy it burns your tongue a little like way fresh onions. Mango, tangerine, a little caramel and some booze. Hazy orange pour. Bitter finish. Nice stuff. Tap at Partisan.

Beautifully murky yellowish pour with just a little foam action. Big mango nose, lightly dank. Hugely flavourful. This beats dipa v3, v8 and v12.. very New England and very much a contender for europes best IPA. For me it is just that.. mouthfeel is on point, finish and aftertaste too. Great beer! Future looking bright for Cloudwater!

17/20 without a doubt the juiciest IPA ever tasted, incredibly easy drinking, so tasty. Wish I could get another

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,44l can at home bought from Beergonzo. Canned 28.03.2017, BB 05/2017. orange quite cloudy color, medium big white head. smells of exotic fruits, mango, lemon grass, lightly grassy, nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of lemon grass, exotic fruits, grapefruit, lychee, peppery, light grapefruit. finishes light to medium bitter with notes of lemon grass, pepper and some citrus. very nice one again, but not the best Cloudwater. I wish for a bit more exotic fruits and some pines. I also actually like it cold quite a bit more better. very smooth drinking experience but rather on the citric side, for me quite similar to v12. will give it another try though..

440 ml can from EeBria.com. Many thanks to Matteo to have introduced me to this world, tasting v12 and Birthday DIPA before this. Exactly, a pack of 6 cans. After the 4th can I finally decided to write my review. Drunk yesterday evening at home in its Cloudwater’s glass (drunk after a Lerving Tasty Juice that for me is a very good beer, but v13 is another level…). Colour is murky hazy orange juice with a moderate white head. Aroma is strong and intense fruity hops. Tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, peach, passion fruit. Full bodied, average carbonation, texture in the mouth is like a juice. No feeling of alcohol despite the 9.0% ABV. Taste is medium sweetness and low to medium bitterness. Finish is long, fruity and bitter.

From can thanks a lot to LukasMH! Pours a super hazy orange juice with a big white head. Aroma has lots of tropical fruits, perfectly fresh citra, oats, light minty, super sweetish multi fruit juice. This shit is intensssse! Taste is sweet, juicy, fat, spicy, estery, mango sweet/acid. Dries out towards the end. Full body and a smooth carbonation. Perfection.
looks grim... hazy, cloudy, rocky head, tan foam, full body, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Tap at Tall Boys Beer Market, Leeds. Pours cloudy pale amber with a lasting white head. Aroma loaded with fruit: peach, mango, pineapple, passion fruit, and caramel, hop. Moderate sweetness, quite light on bitterness. Light to medium body, average to soft carbonation. Back on top form after a more disappointing v12.

440 ml can from Ales by Mail, canned 24/03/17.
Orange, very hazy, milky body, with a big, frothy, strongly lacing, off-white head.
Lovely, dank aroma of apricot jam, orange juice, grapefruit, mango, passion fruit, subtle pine, vanilla.
Tastes quite similar, a bit less dank, a bit dry, with a bit more pine.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes perfect, medium dry, moderate bitter, very crisp, very fruity, citric, a bit yeasty, subtly warm, with sweet fruit flesh that stays forever.

Delicious! The nose is just wonderful, with dense jam and juice notes, supported by a lovely dankness. Taste is a bit straighter compared to the nose, but very fresh and crisp. The finish is another highlight, with a complex, lingering fruit cocktail. Overall this is pretty much on par with my favourite one from the series so far (v8), a great ending to an amazing project, that set a new benchmark for European DIPAs!
Can from hanging bat. Pours hazy light gold. Nose of violets, roses, oranges, apricots, mangos. Taste is juicy tropical fruit, citrus peel, tangy Mandarin.

Oh this is fun. Surprisingly soft aroma of fruit, hint of funk. Looks like that weird tropical juice mix you get at breakfast in some hotels. But its a massive hoppy fruity beast on the taste. I giggled. Vermont to the max!

Looks like its going to be a really thick fruit juice, which isnt too far wrong. Body is full and grainy but with lively carb. Big fruit salad mix - orange, mango, pineapple, banana. The fruit really lingers so the bitterness only creeps in once youre ready for the next mouth full.

Can from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours hazy really hazy orange with a thick off white head. Aroma of orange zest,mango,lemon,passionfruit,spruce & some floral Hops. Taste of orange zest,lemon ,mango with some blueberry . Light bodied with some thou not obvious booze ,sticky hops the finish has more orange zest,lemon,passionfruit ,mango with some dryness .
Keg at the Wolf; completely cloudy golden orange pour with a thin off white head, aroma has some big tropical hop action, hint of green tea, taste has pineapple, mango, tangerine, dank pine.
Its golden, thick and murky with a mild dank-ness to it. Tastes like fruit juice with a hoppy smack to the tastebuds at the end. An absolute juicy banger!!!
Keg at salthorse. Pours hazy yellow orange, nose is grapefruit, orange, taste is juicy citrus, sweet, little salty, pine, herbal.

Keg and can. Murky golden body with a medium off-white head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of orange, lemongrass, apple pie and pine needles. Flavour of pineapple juice, underripe kiwi fruit, creamy orange and peppery hops. Full body with a chewy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. The aroma is not as powerful or enticing as previous versions, and I found this to be a touch on the sweet side, but it is still an amazing DIPA. Its fruity, mouth-coating and incredibly drinkable for the strength. Im gutted I didnt try the first beer in the series, but my order of preference for the others is 11 (my favourite, rated 4.6), 8, 3/4/5/6/13, 2, 10, 7, 9, 12 (my least favourite, rated 3.5).

Keg at Salt Horse. As usual, looks absolutely awful. May be craft but it still looks awful. But doesnt really matter when you expect it. Dense white head. Nose is very juicy exotic fruits, passionfruit, melon, pineapple. Mouthfeel is very rich, not only juicy fruity but its almost like porridge - must be the oats. Slightly boozy. No surprises at this point anymore, but still very solid.

Really hazy peach color with creamy, off-white head. Aroma is really juicy with sweet tangerines, apricots and peaches. There is also a nice grassy/herbal hop note. Taste starts sweet and juicy, really tropical, also grassy, just slightly bitter on the finish. Medium body and carbonation, nice and smooth. Upper tier NE style DIPA!

Can shared. Very hazy golden pour with a white head. Notes of pineapple, passion fruit, dankness, light onion and light sour cabbage in the aroma; juicy hops, tropical fruit, herbal hops, light citrus. Immensely dank, juicy, delicious. Very nice mouthfeel, perfect texture.

440ml can from beermerchants.com. Pours murky orange, large frothy white head. Aroma has familiar exotic fruit cocktail flavours, perhaps a little more pineapple and banana compared to last time. Taste smooth of course, more smoothie-like and creamy in texture possibly due to the oat content. Apricot is present, as is lime, grapefruit, pineapple and passionfruit. Its a fantastically fruity beer, perhaps a little too smooth, but I guess that helps to reign in the alcohol. Really hope CW keep experimenting on future DIPA releases.

Can. Appearance is golden mixed with amber, opaque, thick, cloudy fruit juice, a small fizzy white head which clings a bit. Looks ominous. Aroma- loads of tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, hop resin, grapefruit, ripe fruit, orange juice. Taste- thick, resiny fruit, blended orange peel, tropical fruits, sticky pineapple juice, hops, hop resin, pine, mango, hop bitterness, onion, sweet sugary malt underpins things. Sweet and chewy towards the finish. Mouthfeel is so thick, coating, juicy and syrupy. Its almost like eating a meal. Just an unbelievable beer.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Can at home in London - sourced from Eebria. Pours hazy orange-gold, not as murky as some, with a frothy, pure white head. The nose holds some embarrassingly dank hops, a lot of over-ripe tropical fruits, orange juice, papaya, mango. Medium to big sweet flavour with low bitterness, some biscuity pale malts, faint marmalade, more tangerine, peach, nectarine, pale bread, faint bitterness, a little oily pine, more papaya and mango, a little urine. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with restrained resin, plump citrus, hints of alcohol warmth, more peach and tangerine, mellow pine, pale bread, hints of white grape. An outstanding DIPA, definitely.Ill be curious to see where Cloudwater go with their DIPAs from here. I just cant believe they would deviate too strongly from the course they have so far charted, which rightfully earned them a lot of acclaim. Anyway, Im excited.

440ml can from Beer-Ritz. Cloudy orange-gold colour with a bubbly off-white foam head that diminishes and leaves alittle spotty lacing. Aroma of juicy mango and citrusy hop resin. Taste is malt caramel with sweetish mango, tropical fruits, pineapple, passionfruit, with spicy citrus, pine, mellow yeast and some dank hop resin bitterness. Lovely smooth creamy mouthfeel, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, spicy yeasty dusty bitter finish. Very drinkable DIPA.
Murky orange with a big foamy head. Aroma is sweet fruit juice. More bitterness than I expected, that typical cloudwater flavour from their house yeast and a sweetness at the end. One of their best.

Can, Brewklopedia, Leicester. Cloudy, milky, orange gold with a white foam. Pineapple with mango and mellow sudsy orange. Herbal and leafy with peppery mint. Dank grassiness with bready, spritzy yeast. Green pine. Very resinous. Creamy with a yeasty, peppery and spicy finish. Great.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2017 Can. Pours murky orange/amber. Aroma of mango, passion fruit, peach, grass and pine. Big juicy, fruity taste with some low bitterness and a touch of dankness. Lovely juicy, creamy mouthfeel. Great way to finish the series and look forward to see whats next.

Unlucky for some if the hype train has run you over. Is this The last hurrah? Let's hope they make something more permanent soon. You know what to expect and it delivers. Ie, there's nothing better in this style. All of this series has been really superb.

April 2017 - 440ml can at home in Richmond watching Chungking Express.  As Cloudwater DIPA - v13, 9%. BB May 2017. It has "This is v end" stamped on bottom of can, and I believe this is the last in the series. This is a belated 30th birthday beer for me, as 13 is my lucky number. Pours very murky, opaque vibrant orange, foamy beige head doesnt endure, leaves streaky lacing. Aroma is a touch danky with some plasticine and mango, dried apricot and some soft pineapple. Body is smooth and rounded with soft carbonation. Taste is really smooth with some tinned peach, grassy hops, fruit salad, fruity vibes take over the malts and hop bitterness, but not quite the perfume and dried yeast.  Has that drying breathy cardboard yeast linger I associate with NE IPAs. Too many of these fruit bombs lack bitterness, and this one has a touch more. Maybe still not enough for me, but theres no doubt that the yeast-driven fruit is intense. Great, but I hope their next DIPAs have more hop bitterness.

Intense pine, dank hops, citrus and tropical fruits, sweet and overripe, mango, passion fruit, papaya, pineapple, orange. Very hazy, pale gold, massive creamy white head. Medium sweet. Zesty tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, pine, more dank hops, bitterness intensifies, soft carbonation, full bodied, bittersweet tropical fruits. Very nice IIPA, intense, complex, sad to see this series go. Keg at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey.

Pours murky apricot with low white head. Aroma is a fruit bomb! Mango, peach, passion fruit and pineapple, with hints of lime and vanilla sugar. Taste is mild bitter and hugely fruit sweet in the finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation. One of the best of the series!

440ml can. Opaque cloudy orange colour with a one-finger white head, great retention and lacing on the glass. Aroma is full of juicy tropical fruits and citrus, peel, the taste is also incredibly juicy tropical and citrus, some nice pine as well, yeast, malts too, fruity/malty sweetness wonderfully balanced with a pleasant bitter finish. Very smooth on the palate too, the oats giving it a great mouthfeel with a bit of stickiness, good body and carbonation, feels very easy drinking even at 9% ABV, alcohol is well hidden.
I thought Birthday DIPA was almost perfect and this "revision" of it achieves perfection for me, its exactly what I want from a DIPA - so juicy and fruity and easy to drink. Only the second time Ive done this but Im giving it a perfect score. What an amazing end to the DIPA v series! Excited to see where they go from here.
This is about as good as it gets for big, fat, creamy, thick, juicy NE style DIPAs. Amazing silky thick mouthfeel, incredibly juicy, sweet ripe fruit pulp, light carb and bitterness. Awesome stuff.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 Pours really creamy almost milkshake exceptional balance of hops and malts juicy fruit aroma. Pick any of a dozen fruits per sip. Dangerously easy drinking.silky creamy hoppy finish sublime. Updated Ive had this a few nights ago now but its almost calling me back yeah the aromas understated and the apperance is a tad odd but for taste Ive never had a better beer rethought 4.5

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 Keg at Hop Locker. Pours a really murky orangey gold with a white head that remains. Aroma is a really sweet juicy fruit bomb. Mango and pineapple with some dank pine notes. Taste is really sticky sweet juicy tropical fruits with a sharp hoppiness and pine finish
Really easy drinking and really good stuff.
Can at home to review this. If anything its better with a little age. Still got the really juicy fruit with a bitter Hoppy finish. Uprated a little as its great stuff.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Keg at Hop Locker. It pours murky orange milkshake action with a thick, dense white head. The aroma is rich, sweet, very juicy, creamy, papaya, mango, passion fruit, pine needles, brioche, fruit pie, dank, green hops, spring onion and chive. The taste is rich, decent hit of bitterness (more so that precious iterations), creaminess, very ripe tropical fruits, juicy, papaya, mango, dried apricot, grapefruit, dank, pine needles, grassy, weed, spring onion, light astringency, bit of spice and some mellow alcohol warmth with a drying finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. More bitterness and I would say complexity to this iteration. Perhaps a bit more body also. Very enjoyable stuff. Not quite as good as birthday, but still pretty exceptional. Original rating - 9 - 4 - 8 - 4 - 17 (4.2). Re - rate from can. This really has a great depth of flavour. Plenty going on, yet it has brilliant balance and high drinkability. Upped to 9 - 4  - 9 - 4 - 18 (4.4).

Can at work thanks to Tom. Pours murky yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of grapefruit and tropical fruit juice. Taste is light bitter, juicy tropical fruit, more grapefruit. Light sweet finish. Juice bomb. Easy drinking.

On tap at Café Beermoth, Manchester, Thursday 30th March 2017  Pours gloriously free range yolky yellow colour with a sticky white head. Aroma of passion fruit and mango, really pulpy and juicy. Really soft in the mouth, yes this a glorious sweet, juicy, overripe tropical fruit monster of a beer. Excellent.  A7 A4 T9 P4 Ov17 4.1

Tap, at Cloudwater Barrel Store. Fully opaque, orange gold. Thick, foamy, glossy topped, just off white head. Leggy and shiny down the inside of the glass. Nose has huge, candied citrus peel. Stewed peach. Ripe orange flesh. Some stone fruit esters in the background. No suggestion of the ABV. Taste is super juicy, light citrus fruit bitter. Some fleshy sweetness. Stunning mouthfeel. Smooth, soft, foamy and juicy. Finishes soft and juicy bitter. Theyve ended the series on a big high. Lovely.
